reviews.productTitle: Lutron Skylark LED+ Dimmer Switch for Dimmable LED, Halogen and Incandescent Bulbs | 150W/Single-Pole or 3-Way | SCL-153P-WH | White
reviews.text: After replacing my bedroom LED ceiling lights with CREE high-hats, I experienced LED ghosting. So I replaced my dimmer switch with this Lutron dimmer and 'bam' it fixed my problem. I've used Lutron dimmers before in my whole home and they are the best. Easy to install if you are a little handy. Lots of tutorials on Youtube. It took me 15-20 min to install. I am very meticulous about everything being staright and aligned so I took my time. Make sure to use the ground wire and you probably want to disconnect your circuit breaker to avoid being shocked. I didn't cause I'm a pro and extremely careful, but just as a precaution you probably should. Anyway, very high end quality dimmer. Would not buy anything else. Good Luck!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2025
reviews.title: Very Nice Dimmer

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Skylark LED+ Dimmer Switch for Dimmable LED, Halogen and Incandescent Bulbs | 150W/Single-Pole or 3-Way | SCL-153P-WH | White
reviews.text: I’ve only ever install light switches with the connectors on the side, never the wires in the back. Game changer. I have a 1940’s cape and while my break box is new, not all the wiring is. The wiring in the back made connecting to the thick knob and tube wiring was a breeze. While perfectly safe unless disturbed, I hate knob and tube wiring. The installation went smooth and I greatly appreciated the adjustment knob for led flickering. I’m going to get new bulbs that are approved by Lutron but overall I’m happy with the process. It’s very basic which is exactly what I was looking for. I’m tired of smart home products that constantly disconnect and will be obsolete in 5 years.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.title: Very easy to install

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Skylark LED+ Dimmer Switch for Dimmable LED, Halogen and Incandescent Bulbs | 150W/Single-Pole or 3-Way | SCL-153P-WH | White
reviews.text: Dimmers use phase control of the AC waveform. They stay off for part of the cycle and turn on for the rest of it. This happens 120 (or 100) times a second because each cycle has a positive and negative peak. Leading edge dimmers are the older type. They will work with all incandescents, transformers for low voltage halogens, and some LEDs. They start each half cycle on and switch off somewhere in the middle of a cycle. Trailing edge dimmers are the newer type. They will work with all incandescents and most dimmable LED bulbs. They start each half cycle off and switch on somewhere in the middle of a cycle.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.title: Trailing edge dimmers are recommended for use with LED bulbs
